thread.title: NFL Network apologizes to Bengals shown naked on TV
thread.title_full: NFL Network apologizes to Bengals shown naked on TV

title: NFL Network apologizes to Bengals shown naked on TV
text:
NFL Network apologizes to Bengals shown naked on TV A naked apology Post to Facebook NFL Network apologizes to Bengals shown naked on TV A naked apology  //www.king5.com/story/sports/nfl/2015/10/20/nfl-network-apology-naked-cincinnati-bengals/74255178/   Join the Conversation To   NFL Network apologizes to Bengals shown naked on TV By JOE KAY AP Sports Writer 11:46 p.m. PDT October 19, 2015 Bengals logo CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
CINCINNATI (AP) - The NFL Network has apologized to Bengals players who were shown naked in the locker room during a postgame interview Sunday in Buffalo. 
Alex Riethmiller said a "regrettable mistake by a production team" was behind the video. An NFL Network reporter was interviewing cornerback Adam "Pacman" Jones after a 34-21 win in Buffalo on Sunday, and the videographer's angle included several players coming out of the shower in the background. 
Left tackle Andrew Whitworth was one of those shown. He said on Monday that the league should restrict media access to the locker room to prevent it from happening again. 
Riethmiller says the crew didn't follow network procedures that would have prevented the mistake. Read or Share this story: http://www.king5.com/story/sports/nfl/2015/10/20/nfl-network-apology-naked-cincinnati-bengals/74255178/ TOP VIDEOS
